name: Twenty-Six Martyrs of Japan
summary: The Twenty-Six Martyrs of Japan were a group of Catholics who were executed by crucifixion in Nagasaki on February 5, 1597, by order of Toyotomi Hideyoshi. The group included six Franciscan missionaries (from Spain, Mexico, and India) and twenty Japanese converts, including three young boys. They were the first martyrs of Japan and marked the beginning of over two centuries of persecution. They were canonized in 1862.
